analyzed: de dag dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams kyis dus de srid du rgyags par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are intoxicated by their virtuous and nonvirtuous actions for as long as they last.

original: sgrub par byed pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: They do not practice.

original: de de dag rnams zad par 'gyur bar phyis nges par ltung bar 'gyur ba na nges par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de de dag rnams zad par 'gyur bar phyis nges par ltung bar 'gyur ba na nges par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: When they later fall down, they will understand that their lives are exhausted.

original: kye ma yul kyis bdag bslus so //
analyzed: kye ma yul kyis bdag bslus so //
translated: “Alas, I have been deceived by objects!”

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rtag tu bslus pa rnams ni /🔽lus zhig nas thabs ma yin pas log par lhung ba dmyal ba'am /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rtag tu bslus pa rnams ni / lus zhig nas thabs ma yin pas log par lhung ba dmyal ba'am /
translated: They are deceived by their afflictions.🔽When their bodies disintegrate, they will fall into the lower realms through improper means.

original: yi dvags kyi lus dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnams su skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yi dvags kyi lus dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnams su skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: They will be born in the hells, as hungry ghosts, or as animals.

original: de ltar 'jig rten pa'i las la bag med pa rnams smad par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten pa'i las la bag med pa rnams smad par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the careless ones are condemned for their worldly actions.

original: ji ltar yang lha dag 'jig rten @146a *//
analyzed: ji ltar yang lha dag 'jig rten @146a *//
translated: “The gods in the world of the Heaven Free from Strife

original: las 'das pa'i lam la rgyags pa rnams par smad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: las 'das pa'i lam la rgyags pa rnams par smad pa yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “Why is it a disparagement of the gods’ enjoyments on the transcendent path?,”

original: lha gang dag yin pa'i lha rnams thams cad kyang 'dod pa dag sdug pa dang / yid du 'ong bas legs par byas pa'i las kyi rgyu rnams kyis 'thab bral gyi lha 'di rnams kyi nang du skyes la dam pa'i chos 'dul ba la de bag med par gyur nas des rang gis byas pa'i las rnams mi rtogs so //
analyzed: lha gang dag yin pa'i lha rnams thams cad kyang 'dod pa dag sdug pa dang / yid du 'ong bas legs par byas pa'i las kyi rgyu rnams kyis 'thab bral gyi lha 'di rnams kyi nang du skyes la dam pa'i chos 'dul ba la de bag med par gyur nas des rang gis byas pa'i las rnams mi rtogs so //
translated: it is because all the gods who are gods are born among the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife due to the causes of their virtuous actions, which are attractive and delightful. However, due to their carelessness with regard to the spiritual system of the sacred Dharma, they do not understand the actions they have done.

original: gang dag ches lhag par rgyags par gnas par ma gyur pa rnams de'ang mi brtan pa dang / gang dag rnams pa thams cad du bag med pas rnam par rgyu ba ma yin pa de dag rnams la'ang brten par mi byed la sangs rgyas dang /
analyzed: gang dag ches lhag par rgyags par gnas par ma gyur pa rnams de'ang mi brtan pa dang / gang dag rnams pa thams cad du bag med pas rnam par rgyu ba ma yin pa de dag rnams la'ang brten par mi byed la sangs rgyas dang /
translated: Those who are not excessively intoxicated do not rely on those who are intoxicated, and those who do not wander carelessly in every way do not rely on those who do.

original: chos dang / dge 'dun rnams la'ang lta bar byed pa'i rang bzhin can du mi 'gyur zhing dam pa'i chos 'dul ba rnams la sgrub par mi byed pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug par yang mi byed do; ;de ltar de lam rnam la slob pa'i rang bzhin can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos dang / dge 'dun rnams la'ang lta bar byed pa'i rang bzhin can du mi 'gyur zhing dam pa'i chos 'dul ba rnams la sgrub par mi byed pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug par yang mi byed do; ;de ltar de lam rnam la slob pa'i rang bzhin can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be inclined to look at the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha, and they will not practice the sacred Dharma or the Vinaya. They will not engage in the teachings in the right way, and thus they will not be inclined to train on the path.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams la rnam par lta ba la gtso bor byed par mi 'gyur ro; ;bla ma la nye bar brten par mi byed do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams la rnam par lta ba la gtso bor byed par mi 'gyur ro; ;bla ma la nye bar brten par mi byed do //
translated: They will not focus on dependent origination, and they will not rely on spiritual teachers.

original: lha ye shes la goms par byed pa'i rang bzhin can dang nye bar brten par yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lha ye shes la goms par byed pa'i rang bzhin can dang nye bar brten par yang ma yin no //
translated: They will not be inclined to familiarize themselves with the wisdom of the gods.

original: de ni / 'dod pa rnams kyis @146b bslus nas yul gyis rnam par nyams par byas te /
analyzed: de ni / 'dod pa rnams kyis @146b bslus nas yul gyis rnam par nyams par byas te /
translated: They will be deceived by their desires and ruined by their objects.

original: bdag cag gi lha'i ris nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur la 'chi 'pho ba'i dus na'ang shin tu rab tu 'gyod par 'gyur ro; ;de'i phyir na me bzhin dang / sbrul bzhin du lha dang mi rnams kyi rgyags pa rnams yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gi lha'i ris nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur la 'chi 'pho ba'i dus na'ang shin tu rab tu 'gyod par 'gyur ro; ;de'i phyir na me bzhin dang / sbrul bzhin du lha dang mi rnams kyi rgyags pa rnams yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: We will die and transmigrate from our divine realms, and at the time of death, we will have intense regret. Therefore, like fire and like snakes, we must give up the intoxication of gods and humans.

original: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das gtsug tor can des tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das gtsug tor can des tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
translated: Then, at that time, the Blessed One Śikhin spoke these verses:

original: ji ltar / dang po bag med pas nyer bcom //
analyzed: ji ltar / dang po bag med pas nyer bcom //
translated: “First, one is overcome by carelessness,

original: rgyags pa yis kyang rnam par rmongs //
analyzed: rgyags pa yis kyang rnam par rmongs //
translated: And then, one becomes confused by intoxication.

original: lha rnams sam ni skyes bu yang //
analyzed: lha rnams sam ni skyes bu yang //
translated: Whether one is a god or a human,

original: de ni zhi ba'i thams ma yin //
analyzed: de ni zhi ba'i thams ma yin //
translated: This is not the path to peace.

original: gang zhig rgyags pa mi sgrub pa //
analyzed: gang zhig rgyags pa mi sgrub pa //
translated: Those who do not pursue intoxication

original: skyes bu 'chi ba med pa yin //🔽rgyags pa'i skyon gyis des zin pa'i //
analyzed: skyes bu 'chi ba med pa yin // rgyags pa'i skyon gyis des zin pa'i //
translated: Are people who are immortal.🔽All those people who are seized by the fault of intoxication

original: mi rnams thams cad dmyal bar ltung //
analyzed: mi rnams thams cad dmyal bar ltung //
translated: Will fall into the hells.

original: dam pa min pa'i lam spyod skyon //
analyzed: dam pa min pa'i lam spyod skyon //
translated: The fault of engaging in an inferior path

original: rgyags pa zhes byar 'dir brjod do //
analyzed: rgyags pa zhes byar 'dir brjod do //
translated: Is called ‘intoxication’ here.

original: rgyags pa yis ni rmongs pa'i blo //
analyzed: rgyags pa yis ni rmongs pa'i blo //
translated: The mind that is confused by intoxication

original: lha ni dmyal bar 'gro ba yin //
analyzed: lha ni dmyal bar 'gro ba yin //
translated: The gods will go to hell.

original: yang dag min la dga' bar byed //
analyzed: yang dag min la dga' bar byed //
translated: They delight in what is not real,

original: yang dag 'gyur ba nam yang min //
analyzed: yang dag 'gyur ba nam yang min //
translated: but never in what is real.

original: rgyags pa'i mun pas bskor ba yin //🔽lha rnams 'dod pas rmongs pa yin //
analyzed: rgyags pa'i mun pas bskor ba yin // lha rnams 'dod pas rmongs pa yin //
translated: They are surrounded by the darkness of intoxication.🔽The gods are deluded by desire.

original: 'dod pa yis ni lha rnams rmongs //
analyzed: 'dod pa yis ni lha rnams rmongs //
translated: Desire deludes the gods.

original: rgyags pa yis kyang de bzhin te //🔽dmus long bzhin du dam pa'i las //
analyzed: rgyags pa yis kyang de bzhin te // dmus long bzhin du dam pa'i las //
translated: Intoxication does the same.🔽Like the blind, they do not see

original: de nyid rjes su mthong ba min //🔽de ltar bcom ldan 'das gtsug tor can gyis bag med pa dan g @147a *//🔽rgyags pa'ang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshig rnams kyis bstan nas gzhan 'di'i gsum pa sdom pa ma yin pa'i skyon yang dag par ston pa sku gdung la gnas pa rnams la /
analyzed: de nyid rjes su mthong ba min // de ltar bcom ldan 'das gtsug tor can gyis bag med pa dan g @147a *// rgyags pa'ang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshig rnams kyis bstan nas gzhan 'di'i gsum pa sdom pa ma yin pa'i skyon yang dag par ston pa sku gdung la gnas pa rnams la /
translated: the sacred Dharma.🔽In this way, the blessed Śikhin taught about carelessness and intoxication to the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife using both worldly and transcendent words.🔽Then, the lord of the Heaven Free from Strife, Musulundha, taught the gods about the third fault of non-restraint, which is related to the relics of the Blessed One.

original: de nas thab bral gyi bdag po mu su lundhas lha de rnams la gang dag lus kyis byas pa'i mchod rten las ston no //
analyzed: de nas thab bral gyi bdag po mu su lundhas lha de rnams la gang dag lus kyis byas pa'i mchod rten las ston no //
translated: “The gods, who have created a stūpa with their bodies,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: are as follows:

original: sdom pa ma yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa rnams so //
translated: They are the non-vows.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa'ang skyon chen po gsum gyis lha rnams dang mi rnams la'ang phan par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa'ang skyon chen po gsum gyis lha rnams dang mi rnams la'ang phan par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The non-vows are also not beneficial for gods and humans because of three great faults.

original: 'jig rten pa'i las dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i las la'ang rnam pa thams cad du ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i las dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i las la'ang rnam pa thams cad du ma yin no //
translated: They are not beneficial in any way for mundane and supramundane karma.

original: de la sdom pa ma yin pas mi rnams kyi bar du gcod par 'gyur ba gang yin na /
analyzed: de la sdom pa ma yin pas mi rnams kyi bar du gcod par 'gyur ba gang yin na /
translated: What is the obstruction to humans by the non-vows?

original: 'dir 'jig rten pa'i sdom pa rnams blangs nas rang bzhin gyis mchog tu rmongs pas don dang don ma yin pa mi shes la /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten pa'i sdom pa rnams blangs nas rang bzhin gyis mchog tu rmongs pas don dang don ma yin pa mi shes la /
translated: Here, after taking up the mundane vows, due to natural extreme delusion, one does not know what is beneficial and what is not.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa rnams kyang mi shes so //🔽legs par gnas par byas nas kyang rang gi skye bo dang / gnyen 'dun dang lhan cig tu dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa rnams kyang mi shes so // legs par gnas par byas nas kyang rang gi skye bo dang / gnyen 'dun dang lhan cig tu dga' bar byed do //
translated: One also does not know what is proper and what is improper.🔽Having done so, one delights with one's own people and relatives.

original: rtsi ba grang med par rang gi skye bo dang / gnyen 'brel rnams dang lhan cig du brtan par gnas par byed do //
analyzed: rtsi ba grang med par rang gi skye bo dang / gnyen 'brel rnams dang lhan cig du brtan par gnas par byed do //
translated: Without restraint, one dwells firmly together with one's own people and relatives.

original: byas nas kyang sdom pa @147b yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas nas kyang sdom pa @147b yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And having done so, they will not uphold the vows.

original: de legs par gnas pa las nyams pas kha nyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de legs par gnas pa las nyams pas kha nyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be despised by the world, having fallen from their proper station.

original: rang gi skye bo dang gnyen 'brel thams cad kyis skyug bro bar lta bar byed do //
analyzed: rang gi skye bo dang gnyen 'brel thams cad kyis skyug bro bar lta bar byed do //
translated: All their relatives and friends will look upon them with disgust.

original: gang gi ming gis legs par gnas pa sdom pa brtan po rnams ji lta ba bzhin du yod de zhes rjod par yang byed do //
analyzed: gang gi ming gis legs par gnas pa sdom pa brtan po rnams ji lta ba bzhin du yod de zhes rjod par yang byed do //
translated: They will be known by the name of ‘those who are not properly situated, but pretend to be firm in their vows.’

original: sngags kyi sdom pa rnams sam /
analyzed: sngags kyi sdom pa rnams sam /
translated: They will not be able to keep the mantra vows,

original: legs par gnas par bya ba rnams la yang rung ste /
analyzed: legs par gnas par bya ba rnams la yang rung ste /
translated: or even the proper conduct.

original: de nyid kyi blos rang gi skye ba rnams mi 'jug go /
analyzed: de nyid kyi blos rang gi skye ba rnams mi 'jug go /
translated: With their minds focused on that, they will not engage in their own duties.

original: rang gi pha dang rang gi khyim du bya ba dag gis legs par 'dres par byas pa gang yin pas ngal sos par gyur pa zhes gnas so //
analyzed: rang gi pha dang rang gi khyim du bya ba dag gis legs par 'dres par byas pa gang yin pas ngal sos par gyur pa zhes gnas so //
translated: They will be known as ‘those who are exhausted by their own actions in their own homes and families.’

original: sems stobs yang bde rgyu de dang / gzhi de las dang / de yongs su 'dzin pas gang yang 'di'i grogs por gyur pa de dag rnams thams cad kyang kha phyir phyogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems stobs yang bde rgyu de dang / gzhi de las dang / de yongs su 'dzin pas gang yang 'di'i grogs por gyur pa de dag rnams thams cad kyang kha phyir phyogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and all those who are his friends because of that, because of that basis, and because of his taking care of them, will turn away from him.

original: gzhan pa rnams las gang dag grogs po ma yin pa de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: gzhan pa rnams las gang dag grogs po ma yin pa de dag rnams ni /
translated: And those who are not his friends

original: bzang por gyur pa rjes su rtogs so //
analyzed: bzang por gyur pa rjes su rtogs so //
translated: will recognize his good qualities.

original: gang dag par ma'i tshogs su gnas par gyur pa'i skyes bu de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: gang dag par ma'i tshogs su gnas par gyur pa'i skyes bu de dag rnams ni /
translated: Those people who are in his retinue

original: rtag tu'ang phyogs ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu'ang phyogs ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: will always be in an unfavorable position.🔽Like a tree whose roots have been cut, he will fall

original: rlung gis nye bar bcom pa'i ljon pa rtsa gtan nas bcad pa bzhin du lhung la /
analyzed: rlung gis nye bar bcom pa'i ljon pa rtsa gtan nas bcad pa bzhin du lhung la /
translated: destroyed by the wind.

original: de lhung bas kyang rdzas rnams dang / phun sum tshogs pa dang / rang gi skye bo rnams dang / gnyen 'brel rnams gtong @148a *//
analyzed: de lhung bas kyang rdzas rnams dang / phun sum tshogs pa dang / rang gi skye bo rnams dang / gnyen 'brel rnams gtong @148a *//
translated: And by his falling, he will lose his wealth, his prosperity, his family, and his relatives.

original: ngo // rang bzhin gyis kyang 'gyur ldog can //
analyzed: ngo // rang bzhin gyis kyang 'gyur ldog can //
translated: He will be naturally fickle,

original: tsab hral la gnas pa'i sems mi bsgrungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsab hral la gnas pa'i sems mi bsgrungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and his mind will be unstable and untrustworthy.

original: de skye bo thams cad la brnab sems dang / gnod sems mang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skye bo thams cad la brnab sems dang / gnod sems mang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes envious and malevolent toward all beings.

original: phyin ci log tu dgos pa 'chal ba dang / yongs su rtogs pa dang / blo gdug rtsub can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu dgos pa 'chal ba dang / yongs su rtogs pa dang / blo gdug rtsub can du 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes confused about what is to be done, and his understanding becomes distorted and harsh.

original: de sems can thams cad la zhe 'gras pa dang / gnod sems dang / nga rgyal dang / bzhin rnam par 'gyur zhing gdug pa dang / rang gi yid rnam par g-yeng ba dang / dbul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sems can thams cad la zhe 'gras pa dang / gnod sems dang / nga rgyal dang / bzhin rnam par 'gyur zhing gdug pa dang / rang gi yid rnam par g-yeng ba dang / dbul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes hostile, malevolent, and proud toward all beings. His face is distorted and harsh, and his mind is disturbed. He becomes poor.

original: de sdom pa ma yin pa'i rgyus de dag rnams kyi lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu thabs ma yin par lhung nas dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sdom pa ma yin pa'i rgyus de dag rnams kyi lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu thabs ma yin par lhung nas dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of his lack of restraint, when his body breaks up, he falls into a bad rebirth and is born in hell.

original: de'i phyir na rtag tu phan par 'dod pa'i skyes bus sdom pa 'jig rten pa rnams kyang bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na rtag tu phan par 'dod pa'i skyes bus sdom pa 'jig rten pa rnams kyang bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, a person who always desires his own welfare should keep the worldly restraints.

original: sdom pa la gnas pa'i rgyu des yid shin tu brtan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdom pa la gnas pa'i rgyu des yid shin tu brtan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of his observance of the restraints, his mind becomes very firm.

original: sems kyi rgyud shin tu bzang bar shes nas kyang grogs po rnams kyis kyang yid ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud shin tu bzang bar shes nas kyang grogs po rnams kyis kyang yid ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: His friends and companions will also trust him.🔽He will give away the most secret royal treasures, or

original: mchog tu gsang bar gyur pa'i rgyal po'i don mchog tu rgya che ba'i rin po che rnams sam /🔽gser dang rdzas kyi rigs gzhan rnams la'ang rung ste /
analyzed: mchog tu gsang bar gyur pa'i rgyal po'i don mchog tu rgya che ba'i rin po che rnams sam / gser dang rdzas kyi rigs gzhan rnams la'ang rung ste /
translated: the most precious jewels, or

original: sdom pa'i sems dang ldan pa la kun gtod par byed do //
analyzed: sdom pa'i sems dang ldan pa la kun gtod par byed do //
translated: gold and other precious substances to those who are conscientious.

original: byas nas @148b kyang zhe sdang ba rnams kyis de dag ji lta ba bzhin du sdom par byed pa rnams la gnod pa bya bar yang mi nus so //
analyzed: byas nas @148b kyang zhe sdang ba rnams kyis de dag ji lta ba bzhin du sdom par byed pa rnams la gnod pa bya bar yang mi nus so //
translated: And once he has given them away, he will not be able to be harmed by those who are hostile, even if they are powerful.🔽He will not be frightened by his ministers,

original: gros blo rnams kyis kyang sdom pa 'jigs par mi byed la; rang gi skye bo dang / grogs po dang / yid mthun pa rnams kyis kyang 'jigs par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: gros blo rnams kyis kyang sdom pa 'jigs par mi byed la; rang gi skye bo dang / grogs po dang / yid mthun pa rnams kyis kyang 'jigs par mi byed kyi /
translated: nor by his family, friends, or allies.

original: legs par gnas pa dang ldan pa de la gnyen bshes kyi skye bo rnams kyis mchod par byed do //
analyzed: legs par gnas pa dang ldan pa de la gnyen bshes kyi skye bo rnams kyis mchod par byed do //
translated: Instead, his family and friends will honor him,

original: yid ches pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: and he will become a trustworthy person.

original: slob dpon bzhin du yang slob dpon rnams kyis kyang legs par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: slob dpon bzhin du yang slob dpon rnams kyis kyang legs par sgrub par byed do //
translated: The masters, too, will do their best to help them.

original: sdom pa bdun 'dzin pa rnams ni /
analyzed: sdom pa bdun 'dzin pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who uphold the seven vows

original: rgyal pos kyang mchod par byed do //
analyzed: rgyal pos kyang mchod par byed do //
translated: will be honored by the king.

original: grogs po dang / skye bo dang / gnyen bshes rnams kyis kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: grogs po dang / skye bo dang / gnyen bshes rnams kyis kyang de bzhin te /
translated: Friends, acquaintances, and relatives will do the same.

original: de la skye bo thams cad kyis phun sum tshogs par rdzas sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de la skye bo thams cad kyis phun sum tshogs par rdzas sgrub par byed do //
translated: Everyone will help them to achieve their goals.

original: 'di la'ang don ma yin pa cung zad tsam yang bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di la'ang don ma yin pa cung zad tsam yang bya bar mi nus so //
translated: No one will be able to do anything bad to them.

original: bde mchog tu nor dang ldan par 'gyur ro //🔽de rdzas rnams phun sum tshogs pas sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: bde mchog tu nor dang ldan par 'gyur ro // de rdzas rnams phun sum tshogs pas sbyin pa ni /
translated: They will be wealthy.

original: gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: gtong bar byed do //
translated: With their abundant wealth, they will give generously.

original: bsod nams dag ni /
analyzed: bsod nams dag ni /
translated: They will make merit.

original: byed do // gcig tu legs par gnas pa'i blo nyams pa med pa'i rgyu de dag dang / gleng gzhi de las lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu mtho ris bde 'gro'i 'jig rten lha rnams su skye'o //
analyzed: byed do // gcig tu legs par gnas pa'i blo nyams pa med pa'i rgyu de dag dang / gleng gzhi de las lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu mtho ris bde 'gro'i 'jig rten lha rnams su skye'o //
translated: With their minds firmly established in the causes of irreversibility, when their bodies give out, they will die and transmigrate to the joyful higher realms, taking birth among the gods.

analyzed: de dag dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams la rin chung dus zas dang skom dag blangs nas sbyin pa'i snyad kyi tshong gis yid rab tu dang bas tshong byed do // yon tan gyi khyad par gyi @158a *// gong gis rin thang med pa 'tshong ngo //
translated: They are merchants who, with a pure mind, trade in the name of generosity, buying food and drink with little cost from ascetics and brahmins and then selling it for a high price.

original: de'ang bzhi log gam brgyad log tu byed do //
analyzed: de'ang bzhi log gam brgyad log tu byed do //
translated: They trade in the name of generosity, buying with little cost and selling for a high price.

original: sngar las lhag par bcu log tu'ang byed de //
analyzed: sngar las lhag par bcu log tu'ang byed de //
translated: They trade in the name of generosity, buying with little cost and selling for a high price.🔽They trade in the name of generosity, buying with little cost and selling for a high price.

original: 'di ni; 'dod pa mi bzad pa smad par bya ba rnams las gcig yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni; 'dod pa mi bzad pa smad par bya ba rnams las gcig yin no //
translated: This is one of the most terrible and contemptible desires.

original: gzhan yang mi bzad pa'i 'dod pa ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi bzad pa'i 'dod pa ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: “ ‘There is also another terrible desire.

original: chos smra ba bo rnams kyis chos bstan nas rdzas len no //
analyzed: chos smra ba bo rnams kyis chos bstan nas rdzas len no //
translated: It is when Dharma teachers teach the Dharma in order to receive goods.

original: nor de'ang dkon mchog gsum la bsngo bar mi byed do //
analyzed: nor de'ang dkon mchog gsum la bsngo bar mi byed do //
translated: They do not dedicate that wealth to the Three Jewels.

original: gzhan yang rnam par smad par bya ba'i 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par smad par bya ba'i 'dod pa ni /
translated: “ ‘There is also another contemptible desire.

original: gang dag ye shes la goms pa bskyed par gyur nas kyang rig pa lhag pa gsum bo rnams 'dzin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag ye shes la goms pa bskyed par gyur nas kyang rig pa lhag pa gsum bo rnams 'dzin par byed pa ste /
translated: Those who, having generated the cultivation of wisdom, then hold the three higher knowledges,

original: rab tu byung bar gyur cing re ba med pa dang / kun nas dga' ba med par gyur pa de dag rnams nyid kyi 'dod pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rab tu byung bar gyur cing re ba med pa dang / kun nas dga' ba med par gyur pa de dag rnams nyid kyi 'dod pa 'di ni /
translated: those who have gone forth and are without hope and without delight, their desire

original: rnam par smad par bya ba yin no //🔽yang rnam par smad par bya ba'i 'dod pa gzhan ni /
analyzed: rnam par smad par bya ba yin no // yang rnam par smad par bya ba'i 'dod pa gzhan ni /
translated: is to be condemned.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, another desire is to be condemned:🔽Those who, having gone forth, then sell images of the Blessed One made of

original: gang zhig rab tu byung bar gyur nas kyang sa las byas pa'am /🔽ba so las byas pa'am /
analyzed: gang zhig rab tu byung bar gyur nas kyang sa las byas pa'am / ba so las byas pa'am /
translated: earth,🔽ivory,🔽wood,

original: shing las byas pa'am /🔽dngul las byas pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gzugs 'tshong bar byed pa'o //🔽de dag rnams kyi 'dod pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shing las byas pa'am / dngul las byas pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gzugs 'tshong bar byed pa'o // de dag rnams kyi 'dod pa 'di ni /
translated: or silver.

original: rnam par smad par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smad par bya'o //
translated: Their desire is to be condemned.

original: nor de'ang chos la sngo bar mi @158b byed do; ;de ltar mi rnams kyi'ang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams thob pa la 'dod pa mi bzad pa rnam par smad par bya ba sgyug bro bar gyur pa rtag par rgyun du mdzes par gyur pa ma yin
analyzed: nor de'ang chos la sngo bar mi @158b byed do; ;de ltar mi rnams kyi'ang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams thob pa la 'dod pa mi bzad pa rnam par smad par bya ba sgyug bro bar gyur pa rtag par rgyun du mdzes par gyur pa ma yin
translated: In this way, humans do not have the transcendent Dharma, and their insatiable desires are contemptible, deceitful, and never beautiful.

original: no // ji ltar lha rnams kyi 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: no // ji ltar lha rnams kyi 'dod pa yin na /
translated: “ ‘What do the gods desire?🔽They move around in various ways, experiencing pleasure.

original: de dag gi rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bde ba rnams kyis rnam par rgyu ba rnams yin te; de'ang de ltar khyed rnams 'dod pa mi bzad pa mngon sum nyid du gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bde ba rnams kyis rnam par rgyu ba rnams yin te; de'ang de ltar khyed rnams 'dod pa mi bzad pa mngon sum nyid du gyur pa ni /
translated: In this way, you gods experience insatiable desires.

original: ji ltar gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / aindra n'i la dang / ma h'a ni la dang / shel gyi rang bzhin rnams kyi ri gang dag yin pa de dag la rtsed mo nyams su myong bar byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / aindra n'i la dang / ma h'a ni la dang / shel gyi rang bzhin rnams kyi ri gang dag yin pa de dag la rtsed mo nyams su myong bar byed do //
translated: You experience play on mountains of gold, silver, beryl, sapphire, great sapphire, and crystal.

original: de la ri gcig las ri gzhan rnams la rtsed mo li 'gro ba rnams pho mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: de la ri gcig las ri gzhan rnams la rtsed mo li 'gro ba rnams pho mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba de dag thams cad ni /
translated: On the other mountains, the gods and goddesses play and frolic together in groups.

original: 'dod pas byas kyi /🔽gzhan gyis ni /
analyzed: 'dod pas byas kyi / gzhan gyis ni /
translated: “ ‘All of this is due to desire.

original: ma byas la /
analyzed: ma byas la /
translated: It is not created by anything else.

original: lha khyed rnams yul gyi sred pa dang lhan cig tu 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag gis bcings nas rnam par lhung ba'ang rtogs par mi byed cing ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa rnams ma yin la /
analyzed: lha khyed rnams yul gyi sred pa dang lhan cig tu 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag gis bcings nas rnam par lhung ba'ang rtogs par mi byed cing ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa rnams ma yin la /
translated: You gods are bound by your desires and the craving for objects, and yet you do not realize that you will fall. You do not understand the terrors of the lower realms.🔽You do not understand the terrors of the suffering of disease and death.

original: mi 'dod pa yid du mi 'ong ba yul ljongs dang bral ba'i 'jigs pa'ang med pa dang / nad kyis byas pa'i 'chi ba'i dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa rnams kyang @159a *//🔽rtogs par gyur ta re /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa yid du mi 'ong ba yul ljongs dang bral ba'i 'jigs pa'ang med pa dang / nad kyis byas pa'i 'chi ba'i dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa rnams kyang @159a *// rtogs par gyur ta re /
translated: You do not understand the terrors of the unpleasant and undesirable, of being separated from your delightful environment.

original: lha khyed rnams kyang 'dod pas zil gyis mnan pa'i yid de dang / spyod pa de dag nyid kyis rab tu bzod dka' pa'i ris rnam par 'joms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha khyed rnams kyang 'dod pas zil gyis mnan pa'i yid de dang / spyod pa de dag nyid kyis rab tu bzod dka' pa'i ris rnam par 'joms par 'gyur ro //
translated: Gods, your minds are overcome by desire, and through such conduct you will be unable to bear the destruction of your realm.

original: de ltar lha de dag rnams rnam par 'bral ba dang / nad kyi 'jigs pa'ang med par 'chi 'pho bar gyur pa na'ang 'dod pa rnams kyis yid mi tshim mo //
analyzed: de ltar lha de dag rnams rnam par 'bral ba dang / nad kyi 'jigs pa'ang med par 'chi 'pho bar gyur pa na'ang 'dod pa rnams kyis yid mi tshim mo //
translated: Thus, when the gods are separated from their objects and die, even without the fear of disease, they are not satisfied with their objects.

original: de ltar lha rnams kyis 'jig rten pa'i lam yang mi bzod pa'i 'dod pa rnams kyis par du gcod par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar lha rnams kyis 'jig rten pa'i lam yang mi bzod pa'i 'dod pa rnams kyis par du gcod par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the objects that are not endured by the worldly path are obstacles to the gods.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi lha'i 'jig rten pa rnams kyi bar chad byed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi lha'i 'jig rten pa rnams kyi bar chad byed par 'gyur na /
translated: How are the objects that are not endured by the supramundane path obstacles to the gods?

original: 'di na 'dod pa'i sgra dang / reg bya dang / ro dang / gzugs dang / dri la rab tu 'jug par byed pa spyod pa dam pa ma yin pa la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di na 'dod pa'i sgra dang / reg bya dang / ro dang / gzugs dang / dri la rab tu 'jug par byed pa spyod pa dam pa ma yin pa la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, those who engage in sound, touch, taste, form, and smell, who delight in improper conduct,

original: 'dod pa can gyi lha rnams ni lha gzhan 'dod pa chung bar gyur pa chos 'dul ba la phying ba par rjes su slob pa rnams la thos pas dga' bar byas pa'i yid can ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa can gyi lha rnams ni lha gzhan 'dod pa chung bar gyur pa chos 'dul ba la phying ba par rjes su slob pa rnams la thos pas dga' bar byas pa'i yid can ma yin no //
translated: are not gods who delight in hearing about other gods who have little desire and who are devoted to the Dharma-Vinaya.

original: rtsa ba la chu ldugs pa bzhin du dge ba'i chos rnams thams cad la'ang 'di lta ste /🔽chos kyi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba la chu ldugs pa bzhin du dge ba'i chos rnams thams cad la'ang 'di lta ste / chos kyi rtogs pa'o //
translated: Just as one would water the roots of a tree, one should also water the roots of all virtuous qualities.🔽What are the roots of Dharma?

original: chos kyi rtogs pa de'ang thos pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rtogs pa de'ang thos pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The realization of Dharma does not come about without listening to the Dharma.🔽How could one realize the truth without listening to the truth?

original: de kho na nyid thos pa'ang ji ltar rtogs @159b par mi 'gyur ba dang / bag med pas bag med pa de'ang ci'i rtsa ba las yin /🔽gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i rtsa ba las yin /
analyzed: de kho na nyid thos pa'ang ji ltar rtogs @159b par mi 'gyur ba dang / bag med pas bag med pa de'ang ci'i rtsa ba las yin / gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i rtsa ba las yin /
translated: What is the root of carelessness?🔽It is the root of desire.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: What is the root of desire?

original: de'i phyir na 'dod pa spong ba po gang yin pa de thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'dod pa spong ba po gang yin pa de thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, those who abandon desire will enter the city of nirvāṇa.

original: gang yang 'dod pas btsir ba'i yid can de dag rnams thams cad 'khor ba'i lam la rgyu ba yin no //
analyzed: gang yang 'dod pas btsir ba'i yid can de dag rnams thams cad 'khor ba'i lam la rgyu ba yin no //
translated: Those whose minds are squeezed by desire will all wander on the path of cyclic existence.

original: de ltar na lha rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la'ang lha dang mi rnams kyis bar chad byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na lha rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la'ang lha dang mi rnams kyis bar chad byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, gods and humans create obstacles on the supramundane path of the gods.”

original: de'i phyir blo dang ldan par gyur pas rab tu brtson pas 'dod pa mi bzad pa rnams spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo dang ldan par gyur pas rab tu brtson pas 'dod pa mi bzad pa rnams spang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the wise should strive to abandon the unbearable desires.

original: 'di nas thams cad zang zing gi sbyin pa la rab tu brtson pa de'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di nas thams cad zang zing gi sbyin pa la rab tu brtson pa de'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the result that is in accordance with the cause of one who is intent on giving material things.

original: sbyin pa'i lam de dag rnams nyid ni lha rnams kyis bya bar mi nus par 'dod de /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i lam de dag rnams nyid ni lha rnams kyis bya bar mi nus par 'dod de /
translated: The path of giving is not something that the gods can do.

original: mi gzi brjid che ba rnams kyis byas kyi /
analyzed: mi gzi brjid che ba rnams kyis byas kyi /
translated: It is done by those who have great splendor,

original: lhas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lhas ni ma yin no //
translated: not by the gods.🔽When the gods were human beings, they were delighted in giving, which is difficult to obtain.

original: lha de mir gyur pa na rab tu rnyed dka' ba'i sbyin pa gang yin pa la mngon par dga' ba de gzhan gyis bslus par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lha de mir gyur pa na rab tu rnyed dka' ba'i sbyin pa gang yin pa la mngon par dga' ba de gzhan gyis bslus par gyur pa ste /
translated: They were deceived by others,

original: rin po che'i gling las nyams pa'i tshong pa ngan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: rin po che'i gling las nyams pa'i tshong pa ngan pa bzhin te /
translated: like bad merchants who have lost their way to the island of jewels.

original: 'di ltar yang zang zing gi sbyin pa rnam pa du ma yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang zang zing gi sbyin pa rnam pa du ma yod do //
translated: Thus, there are many kinds of giving of material things.

original: de la mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the giving of fearlessness?

original: rnam pa yang du zhig mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa yin zhe na /🔽mi 'jigs @160a *//
analyzed: rnam pa yang du zhig mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa yin zhe na /🔽mi 'jigs @160a *//
translated: How many kinds of giving of fearlessness are there?🔽The giving of fearlessness is a gateway to the light of the Dharma,

original: pa'i sbyin pa rnam pa gsum yin te /
analyzed: pa'i sbyin pa rnam pa gsum yin te /
translated: Generosity is of three types:🔽giving life, giving wealth, and giving wives and children.🔽Giving life

original: srog yongs su skyob pa dang / nor 'phrog pa rnams yongs su skyob pa dang / de bzhin du gzhan gyi bu dang bu mo 'phrog pa yongs su skyob par byed pa'o //🔽de la srog byin pas ni /
analyzed: srog yongs su skyob pa dang / nor 'phrog pa rnams yongs su skyob pa dang / de bzhin du gzhan gyi bu dang bu mo 'phrog pa yongs su skyob par byed pa'o // de la srog byin pas ni /
translated: means to save the lives of others.

original: lha dang mi rnams su tshe ring bar 'gyur ro //🔽nor 'phrog pa rnams yongs su bskyabs pa las rkun ma las legs par bsrungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams su tshe ring bar 'gyur ro // nor 'phrog pa rnams yongs su bskyabs pa las rkun ma las legs par bsrungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through giving life, one will have a long life among gods and humans.🔽Giving wealth🔽means to save the wealth of others.

original: nor rnams dang yang ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor rnams dang yang ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Through giving wealth, one will be protected from thieves and will have wealth.

original: rgyal po dang / rkun ma dang / chu la sogs pas 'di'i nam yang rdzas rnams 'phrog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po dang / rkun ma dang / chu la sogs pas 'di'i nam yang rdzas rnams 'phrog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One’s wealth will never be stolen by kings, thieves, water, and so on.

original: rgyal por 'gyur ba dang / rgyal po'i blon po rnams su 'gyur ba dang / las de'i 'bras bus rdzu 'phrul che bar 'gyur ba dang / dbang che ba dang / skye ba gzhan thams cad du'ang nor dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal por 'gyur ba dang / rgyal po'i blon po rnams su 'gyur ba dang / las de'i 'bras bus rdzu 'phrul che bar 'gyur ba dang / dbang che ba dang / skye ba gzhan thams cad du'ang nor dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become a king, a king’s minister, and through the result of that karma, one will have great magical power, great influence, and wealth in all one’s other lives.

original: bu dang bu mo rnams kyi mi 'jigs pa byin pas ni /
analyzed: bu dang bu mo rnams kyi mi 'jigs pa byin pas ni /
translated: By giving fearlessness to sons and daughters,

original: bu dang bu mo rnams legs par bzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bu dang bu mo rnams legs par bzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: sons and daughters are well-protected.

original: lha dang mi rnams su 'chi 'pho ba'i dus kyi tshe na'ang de ltar rnam par mi spong ngo //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams su 'chi 'pho ba'i dus kyi tshe na'ang de ltar rnam par mi spong ngo //
translated: At the time of death and transmigration among gods and humans, one does not abandon them in that way.

original: lha dag / de la chos kyi sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lha dag / de la chos kyi sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: Gods, what is the gift of the Dharma?

original: de la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds:

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: mundane and supramundane.

original: de la 'jig rten pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa ni /
translated: Among them, the mundane is

original: bsam @160b gtan bzhir nye bar 'gro ba'i 'jig rten pa'i shes pa dang yang dag par ldan pa byin pas lha dang mi rnams su bde bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam @160b gtan bzhir nye bar 'gro ba'i 'jig rten pa'i shes pa dang yang dag par ldan pa byin pas lha dang mi rnams su bde bar 'gyur te /
translated: the gift of mundane knowledge that goes to the four concentrations, which leads to happiness among gods and humans.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du ste /
translated: Among gods and humans,

original: gal te log par lta bar ma gyur na'o //
analyzed: gal te log par lta bar ma gyur na'o //
translated: if one does not become one of wrong views.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa rnams btang bas rnam par byang ba'i lhar 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams sam /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa rnams btang bas rnam par byang ba'i lhar 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams sam /
translated: By giving the supramundane gift of the Dharma, one is reborn among the gods who enjoy pure abodes,

original: gzugs na spyod pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa rnams su'o //
translated: or in the form realm.

original: de gal te 'dod pa na spyod par skyes na de dgu bcu rtsa brgyad kyi sa la spyod pa'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris drug ji lta ba'i gtso bo rnams su skye'o; ;gzugs na spyod pa rnams su'ang skye ste /
analyzed: de gal te 'dod pa na spyod par skyes na de dgu bcu rtsa brgyad kyi sa la spyod pa'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris drug ji lta ba'i gtso bo rnams su skye'o; ;gzugs na spyod pa rnams su'ang skye ste /
translated: If he is reborn in the realm of desire, he is reborn as a king, a world-emperor, possessing the thirty-two marks of the great man, and having a retinue of a thousand queens, such as Gopā, etc.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He is reborn in the pure abodes and realizes nirvāṇa.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par che ba rnams ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par che ba rnams ni /
translated: Those who have a superior result realize nirvāṇa in a superior way.

original: blo'i khyad par rnams kyis mya ngan las 'das pa lhag par rtogs par 'gyur ro //🔽gnas gtsang ma'i rnams su skye'o //
analyzed: blo'i khyad par rnams kyis mya ngan las 'das pa lhag par rtogs par 'gyur ro // gnas gtsang ma'i rnams su skye'o //
translated: Those who have a superior intention realize nirvāṇa in a superior way.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par gyis rgyal por yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par gyis rgyal por yang 'gyur te /
translated: Those who have a superior dedication become a king,

original: 'khor los gling bzhi la bsgyur ba gser gyi 'khor lo can rin po che dang nye ba bcu bzhi dang yang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor los gling bzhi la bsgyur ba gser gyi 'khor lo can rin po che dang nye ba bcu bzhi dang yang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: a universal monarch, a turner of the wheel of gold, possessing the fourteen treasures, and endowed with the seven jewels.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par gyis kha dog dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par gyis kha dog dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have a superior dedication become endowed with a superior color.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par gyis zag pa rnams zad pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan par yang sems kyi bsngo ba'i khyad par @161a *//🔽gyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par gyis zag pa rnams zad pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan par yang sems kyi bsngo ba'i khyad par @161a *// gyis 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the special dedication of merit, one will exhaust the defilements, become a pratyekabuddha, or become a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dgra bcom pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dgra bcom pa /
translated: Through the special dedication of mind, one will become a buddha.🔽Through the special dedication of Dharma, one will become a buddha, a Bhagavān, a Worthy One,

original: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: a Perfectly Awakened One,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: a Well-Gone One,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
translated: a Knower of the World,

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /

translated: Because of that cause, the sūtra will be taught for the benefit of gods and humans.

original: thub pa bcom ldan 'das 'khor ba 'jig des lha dang mi rnams la chos ston par mdzad pa ni; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thub pa bcom ldan 'das 'khor ba 'jig des lha dang mi rnams la chos ston par mdzad pa ni; 'di lta ste /
translated: The Muni, the Bhagavān, Krakucchanda, teaches the Dharma to gods and humans.

original: rgyu gang gis lha rnams 'gro ba drug nas dang / mi rnams mi rnams nas 'chi 'pho ba dang / lha rnams lha yul du ste /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis lha rnams 'gro ba drug nas dang / mi rnams mi rnams nas 'chi 'pho ba dang / lha rnams lha yul du ste /
translated: Because of that cause, gods will die from the six realms of gods, and humans will die from the human realm, and gods will die in the god realm, and humans will die in the human realm.

original: de ltar phan tshun du 'gro ba drug @176b po rnams phan tshun du dpung gnyen du gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar phan tshun du 'gro ba drug @176b po rnams phan tshun du dpung gnyen du gyur pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the six kinds of beings are mutually related as friends and allies.

original: de la lha dang mi rnams kyang tshul khrims kyis mtho ris su skye ba ni /
analyzed: de la lha dang mi rnams kyang tshul khrims kyis mtho ris su skye ba ni /
translated: As for gods and humans, rebirth in the heavens is due to moral discipline.

original: slu ba med pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: slu ba med pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: This is the unfailing basis.

original: de la tshul khrims de ni; rnam pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims de ni; rnam pa gnyis yin te /
translated: Moral discipline is of two kinds:

original: sdom pa sngar byas pa dang / thar par byas pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa sngar byas pa dang / thar par byas pa'o //
translated: the moral discipline of restraint and the moral discipline of acquiring virtue.

original: de la don yod pa zhes bya ba'i tshul khrims gang zhig don yod pa 'ba' zhig kho nas 'jug pa'i rab tu dang bas sems rab tu dang ba'i dbang gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams la rab tu dang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la don yod pa zhes bya ba'i tshul khrims gang zhig don yod pa 'ba' zhig kho nas 'jug pa'i rab tu dang bas sems rab tu dang ba'i dbang gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams la rab tu dang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As for the moral discipline that is unfailing, it is the moral discipline that is undertaken with a pure mind, with a mind of faith, and with a mind that is solely intent on the unfailing.

original: lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang / ngag gi le par spyod pa dang / yid kyi legs par spyod pa rnams byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang / ngag gi le par spyod pa dang / yid kyi legs par spyod pa rnams byed par 'gyur ro //

original: log par lta ba can du'ang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log par lta ba can du'ang mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du'ang las dang 'bras bu rnams la rgyud dad pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro // chos dang ldan pa'i longs spyod rnams kyang chos kyis longs spyod par byed kyi / gzhan rnams gdung bar byed pa ni /

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //

original: ma dang pha la gus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma dang pha la gus par 'gyur ro //

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams nye bar 'ong ba'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams nye bar 'ong ba'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ro //

original: dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be inclined to listen to the sublime Dharma.

original: mthun pa 'gro ba'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthun pa 'gro ba'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be inclined to go to pleasant places.

original: yongs su 'dri ba'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur te /🔽de ltar don dang ldan pa 'ba' zhig pa kho nas rab tu dang ba ngang yang dag par @177a *//
analyzed: yongs su 'dri ba'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur te / de ltar don dang ldan pa 'ba' zhig pa kho nas rab tu dang ba ngang yang dag par @177a *//

original: ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ldan par 'gyur ro //

original: don dang ldan pa thams cad legs par gang bar spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: don dang ldan pa thams cad legs par gang bar spyod pa yin te /

original: lus kyi legs par spyad pa rnams spyod par byed /
analyzed: lus kyi legs par spyad pa rnams spyod par byed /

analyzed: yid kyi legs par spyad pa rnams spyod par byed kyi /

original: sdom pa 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: sdom pa 'dzin pa ni /

analyzed: ma yin yang de lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du ste /

analyzed: sems kyi spyod pa nyams su myong ba'i dbang gis dge bas gal te 'thab bral gyi lha rnams su skye'o //
translated: Due to the power of their wholesome actions, they are born among the gods in the Heaven Free from Strife.

original: de lha gzhan rnams kyi khyad par gyis gzugs dang / cha byad dang / rgyan dang / bud med dang / yul ljongs dang / zas dman pa rnams la spyod par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de zas la longs spyod pa'i dus na ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro //

original: don yod pa de legs par yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu dang / gzhan sdom pa la gnas pa'i tshul khrims 'dzin pa'i lha rnams kyi khyad par ro //

analyzed: ma yin no //🔽de dag ni /
translated: The result of morality is also the attainment of the state of a god or human being.

analyzed: ma lus par legs par spyod par byed pas spyod pa ni / ma yin no //

analyzed: ngag gi legs par spyod pa rnams kyang thams cad du legs par spyad pa spyod pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who practice good verbal conduct do not practice good conduct in all ways.🔽They do not speak lies,

analyzed: rdzun 'ba' zhig tsam smra bar mi byed la /

original: de'ang don yod pa gcig legs par spyad pa spyod de //
analyzed: de'ang don yod pa gcig legs par spyad pa spyod de //
translated: They practice good conduct for one purpose:

original: gal te de srid pa tha ma'i sems rab tu dang ba'i dbang gis lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i legs par byas pa'i las rnams kyi rkyen gyis 'thab bral ba rnams su skye la shin tu dman par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de srid pa tha ma'i sems rab tu dang ba'i dbang gis lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i legs par byas pa'i las rnams kyi rkyen gyis 'thab bral ba rnams su skye la shin tu dman par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If they are born in the Heaven Free from Strife through the power of faith in the mind of the final existence, they are not born in the lowest class due to the condition of the good karma to be experienced in other lives.

original: sngar gyi don yod par legs par spyad pa spyod pa de'i drung na tshad dang / mdog dang / gzugs dang / cha byad rgyan dang / zas dang / spyod pas gnas pa rnams dang / 'dod pa'i bud med dang / yul ljongs rnams la rim gyis sgra reg ro gzugs dri rnams la'ang ste /
analyzed: sngar gyi don yod par legs par spyad pa spyod pa de'i drung na tshad dang / mdog dang / gzugs dang / cha byad rgyan dang / zas dang / spyod pas gnas pa rnams dang / 'dod pa'i bud med dang / yul ljongs rnams la rim gyis sgra reg ro gzugs dri rnams la'ang ste /
translated: In the presence of those who previously practiced the conduct of the perfections, the gods who practice the pure perfections are inferior in terms of size, color, form, dress, ornaments, food, conduct, and in terms of the women of the desire realm and the landscape.

original: sdom pa dge ba spyad pa'i khyad par can gyi lha gzhan rnams kyi khyad par gyis ni /🔽des rang nyid dman @178a *//
analyzed: sdom pa dge ba spyad pa'i khyad par can gyi lha gzhan rnams kyi khyad par gyis ni / des rang nyid dman @178a *//
translated: In terms of the special gods who practice pure virtue,🔽they see themselves as inferior

original: par mngon par mthong nas ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par mngon par mthong nas ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and are ashamed.

original: gzhan yang don yod par gyur pa'i tshul khrims dang yang dag par ldan pa yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang don yod par gyur pa'i tshul khrims dang yang dag par ldan pa yod de /
translated: Moreover, there are gods who possess the ethics of the perfections.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba can du gyur pa dang / thos pa'i rigs dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa la gus pa'i rigs can du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba can du gyur pa dang / thos pa'i rigs dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa la gus pa'i rigs can du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They have right view, are of a type that listens to the Dharma, and are of a type that respects the Buddha and so on.

original: sdom pa ni /
analyzed: sdom pa ni /
translated: The summary:

original: gcig kyang 'dzin pa'ang ma yin no; ;'on kyang tshul khrims 'chal ba'i tha snyad kyis 'jigs nas ma byin par len par mi byed do //
analyzed: gcig kyang 'dzin pa'ang ma yin no; ;'on kyang tshul khrims 'chal ba'i tha snyad kyis 'jigs nas ma byin par len par mi byed do //
translated: He does not even hold to one, but he does not take what is not given, fearing the label of immorality.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyis gsungs pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus dbul po sgrub par byed pa dang / ma byin par len pas dmyal ba rnams su 'ang skye bar 'gyur ba thos pas kyang ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyis gsungs pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus dbul po sgrub par byed pa dang / ma byin par len pas dmyal ba rnams su 'ang skye bar 'gyur ba thos pas kyang ste /
translated: He does not take what is not given, because he has heard that poverty is the result of giving, and that taking what is not given leads to rebirth in the hells.

original: 'dod pa can yin yang 'jigs pa la sogs pas lus kyis rtag tu ma byin par len pa mi len to //
analyzed: 'dod pa can yin yang 'jigs pa la sogs pas lus kyis rtag tu ma byin par len pa mi len to //
translated: Even though he is passionate, he does not take what is not given with his body, because of his fear of the hells and so on.

original: ngag gis kyang phra ma byed pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin no //
analyzed: ngag gis kyang phra ma byed pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin no //
translated: He does not speak divisively, because he is not of a divisive nature.

original: phan tshun du 'byed par mi byed pa dang / bye ba'i sems can rnams kyang 'byed par mi byed do //
analyzed: phan tshun du 'byed par mi byed pa dang / bye ba'i sems can rnams kyang 'byed par mi byed do //
translated: He does not divide those who are friendly, nor does he side with one in order to split him away from another.

original: legs par 'dzin par yang byed de /
analyzed: legs par 'dzin par yang byed de /
translated: He is a reconciler of those who are divided.

original: ngang tshul ngan pa'i 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas ma yin pa'i gsung yang nyan par mi byed do //
analyzed: ngang tshul ngan pa'i 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas ma yin pa'i gsung yang nyan par mi byed do //
translated: He does not listen to talk that is divisive, because he fears immorality, and because he respects the word of the Buddhas and of those who are not Buddhas.

original: ji ltar phra ma'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: ji ltar phra ma'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: The corresponding effect of divisive speech is

original: grogs po dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / chung ma rnams dang 'byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grogs po dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / chung ma rnams dang 'byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: that one’s friends, male and female servants, and spouse will be divided.🔽The environmental effect is that when one’s body disintegrates and one falls into the lower realms, one will be born in hell.

original: lus zhig nas @178b kyang ngan song log par ltung bar dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur zhes sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas ma yin pa rnams kyi tshig thos pa dang / rgyu gnyis po 'di dag gis de phra  byed pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin no //🔽de lus zhig nas sems tha ma'i dbang gis dang / lus lan grangs gzhan la legs par byas pa'i dbang gis kyang rung /
analyzed: lus zhig nas @178b kyang ngan song log par ltung bar dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur zhes sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas ma yin pa rnams kyi tshig thos pa dang / rgyu gnyis po 'di dag gis de phra  byed pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin no // de lus zhig nas sems tha ma'i dbang gis dang / lus lan grangs gzhan la legs par byas pa'i dbang gis kyang rung /
translated: Because of these two causes, one will not be inclined to engage in divisive speech.🔽When one’s body disintegrates and one falls into the lower realms, one will be born in hell.

original: gal te brgyal na zhing la rab tu dang ba med par yang brgyal na 'thab bral gyi lha rnams kyi nang du skyes na de ches dman pa'i tshad dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te brgyal na zhing la rab tu dang ba med par yang brgyal na 'thab bral gyi lha rnams kyi nang du skyes na de ches dman pa'i tshad dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is reborn among the gods in the Heaven Free from Strife, one will be of the lowest rank, with the least amount of splendor, color, and shape.

original: bud med dang / yul ljongs dang / zas dman pa rnams la spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med dang / yul ljongs dang / zas dman pa rnams la spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will experience women, landscapes, and inferior tastes.

original: sgra dang / reg bya dang / gzugs dang / ro dang / dri rnams dman par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra dang / reg bya dang / gzugs dang / ro dang / dri rnams dman par 'gyur ro //
translated: His sounds, textures, forms, tastes, and smells will be inferior.

original: tshe shin tu dman par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe shin tu dman par 'gyur ro //
translated: His life will be very short.

original: 'od dman par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od dman par 'gyur ro //
translated: His light will be inferior.

original: lha gzhan rnams kyi drung du shin tu'ang ngo tsha ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha gzhan rnams kyi drung du shin tu'ang ngo tsha ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be very embarrassed in the presence of other gods.

original: don yod pa de dag gi rab tu dang ba'i dbang gis lha'i skye ba gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: don yod pa de dag gi rab tu dang ba'i dbang gis lha'i skye ba gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: By the power of his faith in Amoghasiddhi, he will be reborn as a god three times.🔽It is only by faith in the Buddha and so on that he will be reborn as a god.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa la rab tu dang ba 'ba' zhig gis dang / de ltar sems kyi yon tan gyi khyad par rnams kyis sam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa la rab tu dang ba 'ba' zhig gis dang / de ltar sems kyi yon tan gyi khyad par rnams kyis sam /

original: sems 'jam por gyur pa'i khyad par gyis sam /
analyzed: sems 'jam por gyur pa'i khyad par gyis sam /
translated: Or it is by the special quality of his gentle mind.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la rab tu dang ba'i khyad par gyis sam /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la rab tu dang ba'i khyad par gyis sam /
translated: Or it is by the special quality of his faith in the correct view.

original: bsam pa nye bar skyes pa'i sems kyi khyad par rnams kyang 'di @179a *//
analyzed: bsam pa nye bar skyes pa'i sems kyi khyad par rnams kyang 'di @179a *//
translated: Or it is by the special quality of his mind that has generated the thought of enlightenment.

original: lta ste; ma dang pha la shin tu gus pa dang / legs par nyan pa'am /🔽yon tan gyi khyad par dag gis sam /🔽smon lam gyi khyad par dag gis kyang ste /🔽ji ltar de'i sems kyi rgyud dang / zhing la rab tu dang ba'i dbang gi sems kyi yon tan dman pa dang / par ma dang / khyad par 'phags pa'i las kyi khyad par gyis rnam pa de lta bu nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta ste; ma dang pha la shin tu gus pa dang / legs par nyan pa'am / yon tan gyi khyad par dag gis sam / smon lam gyi khyad par dag gis kyang ste / ji ltar de'i sems kyi rgyud dang / zhing la rab tu dang ba'i dbang gi sems kyi yon tan dman pa dang / par ma dang / khyad par 'phags pa'i las kyi khyad par gyis rnam pa de lta bu nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because of the power of the purity of his mind and his field,🔽by the power of his former aspirations,🔽and by the power of his former actions,🔽which were either inferior, middling, or superior.🔽
