original: de la mdor bsdu na 'khor bzhi'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: de la mdor bsdu na 'khor bzhi'i sdom pa'o //
translated: In brief, there are four types of layperson.

original: de der gtogs pa'i bzhi ni /
analyzed: de der gtogs pa'i bzhi ni /
translated: The four types of layperson are

original: dge sbyong dang / dge sbyong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i ste /🔽de dag ni /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang / dge sbyong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i ste / de dag ni /
translated: the male and female layperson, the male and female novice, and the male and female monk.

original: 'khor rnam pa bzhi yin no //🔽de la'ang de dag gi sdom pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor rnam pa bzhi yin no // de la'ang de dag gi sdom pa ni /
translated: These are the four types of layperson.

original: gang yin / rnam pa ni /
analyzed: gang yin / rnam pa ni /
translated: What is the nature of the vows of these laypeople?

original: du zhig yod /
analyzed: du zhig yod /
translated: How many types of vows are there?

original: de dag gi sdom pa rnams pa  ni /
analyzed: de dag gi sdom pa rnams pa  ni /
translated: What are the characteristics of the vows?

original: ji ltar 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: How are the vows obtained?

original: de la dge bsnyen mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la dge bsnyen mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: In brief, there are four types of layperson.

original: bzhi po rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi po rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: phyogs gcig la spyod par gyur pa @179b dang / mthar thug par spyod pa dang / thams cad la spyod pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams las sdom pa gcig blangs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig la spyod par gyur pa @179b dang / mthar thug par spyod pa dang / thams cad la spyod pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams las sdom pa gcig blangs pa'o //
translated: The layperson who practices one part, the layperson who practices the ultimate, the layperson who practices all, and the layperson who has taken the vow of one part of the precepts.

original: mthar thug par spyod pa ni /
analyzed: mthar thug par spyod pa ni /
translated: The layperson who practices the ultimate

original: bslab pa'i gzhi sdom pa blangs pa la spyod pa'am phal cher la gnas nas spyod pa ste /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi sdom pa blangs pa la spyod pa'am phal cher la gnas nas spyod pa ste /
translated: practices the precepts of the vow or practices the majority of the precepts.

original: sdom pa'i gzhi de'ang yang dag par 'dzin to //
analyzed: sdom pa'i gzhi de'ang yang dag par 'dzin to //
translated: He or she also perfectly upholds the basis of the vow.

original: thams cad la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad la spyod pa ni /
translated: The fourth is the one who practices all.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi lnga yang dag par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi lnga yang dag par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He is the one who takes up all five precepts.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There is another fourfold classification:

original: snga phyir bslab pa'i gzhi la spyod pa dang / kun tu nyams pa med par spyod pa dang / 'gyod nas spyod pa dang / thams cad kun tu nyams par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: snga phyir bslab pa'i gzhi la spyod pa dang / kun tu nyams pa med par spyod pa dang / 'gyod nas spyod pa dang / thams cad kun tu nyams par spyod pa'o //
translated: the one who practices the precepts in a gradual manner, the one who practices without ever falling away, the one who practices with regret, and the one who practices with a complete fall.

original: de la dge bsnyen bslab pa'i gzhi la snga phyir spyod pa ni /
analyzed: de la dge bsnyen bslab pa'i gzhi la snga phyir spyod pa ni /
translated: The upasaka who practices the precepts in a gradual manner

original: gang bslab pa'i gzhi rgya mtsho la snga phyir bgrod par byed pas snga phyir bgrod par byed do //
analyzed: gang bslab pa'i gzhi rgya mtsho la snga phyir bgrod par byed pas snga phyir bgrod par byed do //
translated: is the one who gradually practices the precepts, because he practices the precepts in a gradual manner in the ocean of precepts.

original: de dang po kho nar gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i dge bsnyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang po kho nar gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i dge bsnyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: First of all, he becomes an upasaka who has taken refuge in the Three Jewels.

original: phyi nas dus snga phyir sems kyis bsgoms nas yon tan legs pa dang ldan par byas te; bslab pa'i gzhi gcig legs par 'dzin no //🔽de yang ma nyams pa /🔽ma chad pa /
analyzed: phyi nas dus snga phyir sems kyis bsgoms nas yon tan legs pa dang ldan par byas te; bslab pa'i gzhi gcig legs par 'dzin no // de yang ma nyams pa / ma chad pa /
translated: Later, after he has cultivated his mind in a gradual manner, he acquires good qualities and takes up one precept well.🔽He does not violate it,🔽does not break it,

original: ma zags par 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: ma zags par 'dzin par byed do //
translated: and does not let it lapse.

original: de lam nyams pa'i rnam pa 'di lta bu  gang yin /🔽ma chad pa'i rnam pa 'di lta bu gang yin /
analyzed: de lam nyams pa'i rnam pa 'di lta bu  gang yin / ma chad pa'i rnam pa 'di lta bu gang yin /
translated: What is the form of a path that has been violated?🔽What is the form of a path that has been interrupted?

original: ma zags pa'i rnam pa de lta bu gang yin na /
analyzed: ma zags pa'i rnam pa de lta bu gang yin na /
translated: What is the form of a path that has been damaged?

original: ma nyams pa zhes bya ba ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bdag nyid kyis 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: ma nyams pa zhes bya ba ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bdag nyid kyis 'dzin pa ste /
translated: “Not violated” means that as long as one lives, one holds to it oneself.

original: @180a *// sems kyis kyang sdom pa las 'da' bar 'gyur ba sems par mi byed do //
analyzed: @180a *// sems kyis kyang sdom pa las 'da' bar 'gyur ba sems par mi byed do //
translated: One does not even think of transgressing the vow in one’s mind.

original: gzhan byed pa na'ang rjes su yi rang par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan byed pa na'ang rjes su yi rang par mi byed do //
translated: One does not rejoice when others do it.

original: byed pa'ang 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: byed pa'ang 'gog par byed do //
translated: One stops those who are doing it.

original: de dag rnams chos la'ang 'god par byed do //
analyzed: de dag rnams chos la'ang 'god par byed do //
translated: One establishes them in the Dharma.

original: 'di ni / ma nyams pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni / ma nyams pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This is called “not violated.”

original: de la ma chad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ma chad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is “interrupted”?

original: de nyid kyis 'dir brgyal na bslab pa'i gzhi rnams gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis 'dir brgyal na bslab pa'i gzhi rnams gtong bar byed do //
translated: If one faints, one gives up the precepts.

original: gal te na 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: gal te na 'dzin par byed do //
translated: If one does not, one holds to them.

original: yang dang yang du btang nas slar yang len par byed do //
analyzed: yang dang yang du btang nas slar yang len par byed do //
translated: Having given them up again and again, one takes them up again.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu ni /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu ni /
translated: This is the form of an interrupted path.

original: chad pa yin no //
analyzed: chad pa yin no //
translated: This is called “interrupted.”

original: de la 'dis ni /
analyzed: de la 'dis ni /
translated: Here,

original: chad pa dang bral bar byas shing 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: chad pa dang bral bar byas shing 'dzin par byed do //
translated: He is free from the fault of holding and he holds.

original: ji ltar nam zags pa 'dzin pa yin zhing zags pa'ang ji ltar yin na /🔽'di ni / bslab pa'i gzhi la dang po nyid du rab tu dang ba'i sems kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung nas bzung ba las de phyi nas 'gyod pa dang bcas par gyur nas mi 'dzin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nam zags pa 'dzin pa yin zhing zags pa'ang ji ltar yin na / 'di ni / bslab pa'i gzhi la dang po nyid du rab tu dang ba'i sems kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung nas bzung ba las de phyi nas 'gyod pa dang bcas par gyur nas mi 'dzin no //
translated: How is he free from the fault of holding? How is he free from the fault of letting go?🔽He is free from the fault of holding because he first holds the precepts with a pure mind in the presence of a spiritual friend.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i chu bos khyer ro //🔽de sems rnyog pa dang bcas pas spyod par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i chu bos khyer ro // de sems rnyog pa dang bcas pas spyod par byed do //
translated: He is free from the fault of letting go because he is not carried away by the river of conceptual thought.🔽He is free from the fault of letting go because he does not practice with a disturbed mind.

original: sems la rnyog pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems la rnyog pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is free from the fault of letting go because his mind is undisturbed.

original: de phyi nas 'gyod pa'i mes sreg par byed la /🔽bsregs par gyur nas kyang yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: de phyi nas 'gyod pa'i mes sreg par byed la / bsregs par gyur nas kyang yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: He is free from the fault of letting go because he is not burned by the fire of regret.🔽He is free from the fault of letting go because he does not let go of what he has burned.

original: yongs su btang nas phyir mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: yongs su btang nas phyir mi 'dzin to //
translated: He is free from the fault of letting go because he does not let go of what he has not burned.

original: 'di ni / zags pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni / zags pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This is called letting go.

original: des 'di @180b ni; de bzhin du mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: des 'di @180b ni; de bzhin du mi 'dzin to //
translated: He does not hold in this way.

original: gzhan yang snga phyi bar sbyong ba'i dge bsnyen de nyid ma nyams pa dang / ma chad ba dang / ma zags par bslab pa'i gzhi rnams 'dzin par byed pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang snga phyi bar sbyong ba'i dge bsnyen de nyid ma nyams pa dang / ma chad ba dang / ma zags par bslab pa'i gzhi rnams 'dzin par byed pa la /
translated: Furthermore, the upāsaka who trains in the beginning, middle, and end, who does not violate, does not break, and does not leak the bases of training,

original: ji ltar ma nyams pa yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar ma nyams pa yin na /
translated: How is it that he does not violate?

original: 'di'i sems la dri ma med pa rko tog ma yin pa'i dge bar gyur nas kyang mi dge bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i sems la dri ma med pa rko tog ma yin pa'i dge bar gyur nas kyang mi dge bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If his mind is not free from defilements, it becomes virtuous and then nonvirtuous.

original: chu shing gi lo ma dang glog dang 'dra bar de rab tu rngam par gyur pa'i sems kyis dge ba'i sems su gyur nas sdom pa 'di 'dzin par byed la /
analyzed: chu shing gi lo ma dang glog dang 'dra bar de rab tu rngam par gyur pa'i sems kyis dge ba'i sems su gyur nas sdom pa 'di 'dzin par byed la /
translated: Like the leaves of a plantain tree or a flash of lightning, with a mind that is very agitated, he becomes virtuous-minded and takes up this vow.

original: de rab tu dang ba dang / gus pa dang bcas par yang gyur nas de phyis gal te shed na mu stegs pa'i gnas nas thos na 'gyod par gyur te rnyog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur nas gtong ngo //
analyzed: de rab tu dang ba dang / gus pa dang bcas par yang gyur nas de phyis gal te shed na mu stegs pa'i gnas nas thos na 'gyod par gyur te rnyog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur nas gtong ngo //
translated: If he becomes very faithful and respectful, but later, if he hears the doctrines of the tīrthikas, he becomes regretful, his mind becomes disturbed, and he gives it up.

original: phyis yang dam pa'i chos thos nas 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: phyis yang dam pa'i chos thos nas 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Later, he hears the true Dharma and takes it up again.

original: 'di ni / nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / nyams pa yin no //
translated: This is violation.

original: gzhan yang chad pa ji ltar chad par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang chad pa ji ltar chad par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: Moreover, how is it that they are cut off?

original: 'di ni / dge bsnyen dag gya gyus bslab pa'i gzhi 'dzin pas gal te na lha rnams mchod par byed pa na gal te ji ltar sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i chos des dga' bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ni / dge bsnyen dag gya gyus bslab pa'i gzhi 'dzin pas gal te na lha rnams mchod par byed pa na gal te ji ltar sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i chos des dga' bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If the lay followers are crooked in their observance of the precepts, then when they worship the gods, they will be happy if the gods speak in accordance with the Buddha’s teachings.

original: yang na lha de'i tshig gis bdag la bde 'gror 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na lha de'i tshig gis bdag la bde 'gror 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, if the gods speak in a way that leads them to a good rebirth,

original: de lta bu des dogs par byas nas chos spyod par byed de /
analyzed: de lta bu des dogs par byas nas chos spyod par byed de /
translated: then they will practice the Dharma out of fear of the gods.

original: 'di ni / chad pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni / chad pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This is called “cut off.”

original: gzhan yang zags pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang zags pa gang zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is “leaking”?

original: @181a *// 'di na nang stong par gyur pa rnams phyi rol na sems dge bzhin du gzhan rnams la mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: @181a *// 'di na nang stong par gyur pa rnams phyi rol na sems dge bzhin du gzhan rnams la mtshon par byed do //
translated: Here, those who are empty within show themselves to others as if they were wholesome in mind.

original: de yang na rul bar gyur kyang yod ches pa bskyed pa'i don du bslab pa'i gzhi rnams 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: de yang na rul bar gyur kyang yod ches pa bskyed pa'i don du bslab pa'i gzhi rnams 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Even if they are rotten inside, they observe the precepts in order to generate great merit.

original: 'di ni / nang stong pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / nang stong pa yin no //
translated: This is “empty within.”

original: snga phyir bslab pa'i gzhi la spyod pa'i dge bsnyen des 'di spong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: snga phyir bslab pa'i gzhi la spyod pa'i dge bsnyen des 'di spong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The lay practitioner who practices the bases of training in stages abandons this.

original: de la ji ltar na thun tshags su spyod pa'i dge bsnyen yin na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na thun tshags su spyod pa'i dge bsnyen yin na /
translated: How is one a lay practitioner who practices in stages?

original: 'di la bslab pa'i gzhi gcig blangs nas dus par chod par gyur na de rnam par spyod pa por gyur nas bslab pa'i gzhi gzhan 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: 'di la bslab pa'i gzhi gcig blangs nas dus par chod par gyur na de rnam par spyod pa por gyur nas bslab pa'i gzhi gzhan 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Here, having taken up one base of training, if time passes and one becomes a practitioner, one takes up another base of training.

original: de ltar snga phyi rim pas de'i dus kyi sems bskyed pa gcig gis bla ma gcig ma yin pa'i drung nas de ltar thun tshags su gyur pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams snga phyi'i dus su 'dzin no //
analyzed: de ltar snga phyi rim pas de'i dus kyi sems bskyed pa gcig gis bla ma gcig ma yin pa'i drung nas de ltar thun tshags su gyur pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams snga phyi'i dus su 'dzin no //
translated: In this way, by the gradual sequence of earlier and later, by the generation of the mind at that time, not from one guru but from many gurus, the bases of training that are practiced in stages are taken up in earlier and later times.

original: 'di ni / snga phyir bslab pa spyod pa'i dge bsnyen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / snga phyir bslab pa spyod pa'i dge bsnyen zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the lay practitioner who practices the bases of training in stages.

original: gzhan yang dge bsnyen gnyis ma yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge bsnyen gnyis ma yod de /
translated: Moreover, there are two other types of lay practitioners:

original: phyed nyams par spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyed nyams par spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the lay practitioner who practices with a half, and🔽the lay practitioner who practices with a quarter.

original: phyed nyams par spyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyed nyams par spyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the lay practitioner who practices with a half?

original: 'di na bslab pa'i bzhi rnams dus gcig tu ni /
analyzed: 'di na bslab pa'i bzhi rnams dus gcig tu ni /
translated: Here, the four bases of training are taken up at one time.

original: mi 'dzin la ci ste na gnyis ste ; sngar ro //🔽dus bar du chod par gyur pas gsum ni /🔽phyi nas so //
analyzed: mi 'dzin la ci ste na gnyis ste ; sngar ro // dus bar du chod par gyur pas gsum ni / phyi nas so //
translated: The one who possesses two previously.

original: ci ste na gsum ni /
analyzed: ci ste na gsum ni /
translated: What is the one who possesses three?🔽The one who possesses three previously.🔽What is the one who possesses two later?

original: sngar ro // phyi nas gnyis 'dzin no //
analyzed: sngar ro // phyi nas gnyis 'dzin no //
translated: The one who possesses two later.

original: len par yang byed do //🔽'di la ni /🔽phyed @181b nyams pa spyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: len par yang byed do // 'di la ni / phyed @181b nyams pa spyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He also takes up the precepts.🔽What is the one who practices with a half?

original: bslab pa'i gzhi phyed nyams par gyur pa'i rgyu gang yin pas so //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi phyed nyams par gyur pa'i rgyu gang yin pas so //
translated: He is called the one who practices with a half because he has half of the causes for the loss of the precepts.

original: phyed nyams pa rnam par yang 'dzin to //🔽'di la ni /
analyzed: phyed nyams pa rnam par yang 'dzin to // 'di la ni /
translated: He also takes up the precepts with a half.

original: phyed nyams par spyod pa'i dge bsnyen zhes brjod de /
analyzed: phyed nyams par spyod pa'i dge bsnyen zhes brjod de /
translated: What is the one who is called the upasaka who practices with a half?🔽The third upasaka is the one who takes up the precepts with regret.

original: gnyis pa'o // 'gyod pa dang bcas nas 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i dge bsnyen gsum pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis pa'o // 'gyod pa dang bcas nas 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i dge bsnyen gsum pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the upasaka who takes up the precepts with faith?

original: sngar bslab pa'i gzhi 'dzin pa mi byed la don yod pa'i rab tu dang ba 'ba' zhig gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa la rab tu dang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar bslab pa'i gzhi 'dzin pa mi byed la don yod pa'i rab tu dang ba 'ba' zhig gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa la rab tu dang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not take up the precepts previously, but he has faith in the Buddha, etc., only through the faith in the efficacy of the precepts.

original: de gal te shed na dge slong rnams kyi drung nas sdom pa'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug par 'gyur ba thos par 'gyur la 'bras bu de thos nas kyang 'gyod pa'i mes sreg par gyur pas gus pa dang bcas par gyur nas ji srid
analyzed: de gal te shed na dge slong rnams kyi drung nas sdom pa'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug par 'gyur ba thos par 'gyur la 'bras bu de thos nas kyang 'gyod pa'i mes sreg par gyur pas gus pa dang bcas par gyur nas ji srid
translated: If he hears from the monks that the result of vows is the ultimate nirvana, he will be burned by the fire of regret and will be filled with respect.🔽

original: 'tsho'i bar du bslab pa'i gzhi rnams 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: 'tsho'i bar du bslab pa'i gzhi rnams 'dzin par byed do //
translated: If he hears from the monks that the result of the vows is the ultimate nirvāṇa, he will be burned by the fire of regret and will respectfully maintain the bases of training for as long as he lives.

original: 'gyod pa dang bcas pa'i dge bsnyen zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang bcas pa'i dge bsnyen zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The fourth type of layperson is called “the layperson with regret.”

original: 'di la brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: gzhan yang dge bsnyen bzhi pa yod de /🔽thams cad kun nas tshogs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge bsnyen bzhi pa yod de / thams cad kun nas tshogs par spyod pa'o //
translated: There is also a fourth type of layperson🔽who practices all the precepts in their entirety.

original: thams cad kun nas tshogs par spyod par gyur pa'i dge bsnyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad kun nas tshogs par spyod par gyur pa'i dge bsnyen gang zhe na /
translated: What is a layperson who practices all the precepts in their entirety?

original: 'di ni / dam pa'i chos rnams la thos pa dang ldan par gyur nas tshig dang tshig tu gyur pa rnams dang / gnas rnams dang / mdo dang mdo rnams las rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i @182a *//

analyzed: de ltar 'khor rnam pa gcig yin te /

analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dge bsnyen gyi 'khor ro // dge bsnyen ma'i 'khor ro // dge bsnyen ma'i 'khor rnams ni /

original: de yang khyad par du gyur pa kho na'i dbyibs su gyur pa dang / zas la spyod pa /
analyzed: de yang khyad par du gyur pa kho na'i dbyibs su gyur pa dang / zas la spyod pa /
translated: He also adopts their posture, the way they eat,🔽the way they wear their robes, and the way they walk and sit.

original: chos gos gyon pa dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i yon tan rnams rab tu zhi ba'i spyod lam mthong nas skyabs su 'gro ba'i rim gyis gzhan mu stegs can rnams dang / dge sbyong rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa legs par gyur pas sangs rgyas @185a *//
analyzed: chos gos gyon pa dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i yon tan rnams rab tu zhi ba'i spyod lam mthong nas skyabs su 'gro ba'i rim gyis gzhan mu stegs can rnams dang / dge sbyong rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa legs par gyur pas sangs rgyas @185a *//
translated: Seeing their peaceful behavior, he goes for refuge and gradually becomes superior to non-Buddhists and monks.

original: la sogs pa la rab tu dang ba dang / des gdul ba'ang yin la sdom pa'ang 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: la sogs pa la rab tu dang ba dang / des gdul ba'ang yin la sdom pa'ang 'dzin par byed do //
translated: and so on, and who has faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, and who takes up the precepts.

original: 'di ni / gnas lhan cig tu byas pa zhes bya ba'i dge bsnyen ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / gnas lhan cig tu byas pa zhes bya ba'i dge bsnyen ma yin no //
translated: This is the upasaka who is called “one who has taken up the precepts together with the bases.”

original: de rnams kyang bzhi bzhi dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma rnams yin la /
analyzed: de rnams kyang bzhi bzhi dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma rnams yin la /
translated: These are the four types of upasakas and upasikas.

original: dge bsnyen ma bzhi mdor bsdus nas ni; rnam par bzhag pa yin la /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma bzhi mdor bsdus nas ni; rnam par bzhag pa yin la /
translated: The four types of upasikas are summarized and presented.

original: gal te shed na mos pa'i dbang dang mos pa'i dbang gis dang / sems kyi rgyud kyi dbang gis dang / rkyen gyi dbang gis kyang gang kho na sngar brjod pa'i dge bsnyen gyi rnams rkyen gyis dge bsnyen ma la'ang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te shed na mos pa'i dbang dang mos pa'i dbang gis dang / sems kyi rgyud kyi dbang gis dang / rkyen gyi dbang gis kyang gang kho na sngar brjod pa'i dge bsnyen gyi rnams rkyen gyis dge bsnyen ma la'ang 'gyur ro //
translated: If, by the power of faith, by the power of the mind, and by the power of conditions, the upasakas mentioned above become upasikas by conditions.

original: chos 'dul ba'i rkyen gyis dge bsnyen ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: chos 'dul ba'i rkyen gyis dge bsnyen ma yin pa ni /
translated: The upasika who is a condition of the Dharma and Vinaya

original: sngar bshad pa'i dge bsnyen la yang 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i dge bsnyen la yang 'jug pa yin no //
translated: is also included in the upasakas explained above.

original: sems kyi rgyud kyi dbang gis de'ang 'dren mar spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud kyi dbang gis de'ang 'dren mar spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: By the power of the mind, she is also called a “mixed practitioner.”

original: dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma de dag thams cad kyang dge ba'i skal pa can /
analyzed: dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma de dag thams cad kyang dge ba'i skal pa can /
translated: All of these male and female lay practitioners are endowed with virtue.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba can /🔽yang dag pa'i lta ba sngon du btang ba rnams dman pa dang / bar ma dang / khyad bar du 'phags pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyis lus zhig pa na mtho ris bde 'gro lha'i ris rnams kyi 'jig rten dman pa dang / bar ma dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba can / yang dag pa'i lta ba sngon du btang ba rnams dman pa dang / bar ma dang / khyad bar du 'phags pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyis lus zhig pa na mtho ris bde 'gro lha'i ris rnams kyi 'jig rten dman pa dang / bar ma dang /
translated: They have right view.

original: khyad par du 'phags @185b pa rnams su skye'o //🔽de la 'ga' zhig ni /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags @185b pa rnams su skye'o // de la 'ga' zhig ni /
translated: When their bodies disintegrate, they are reborn in the lower, intermediate, or higher realms of the gods, in accordance with their inferior, intermediate, or superior mindstreams.

original: 'thab bral gyi lha rnams gang dag gi nang du skye ste /
analyzed: 'thab bral gyi lha rnams gang dag gi nang du skye ste /
translated: Some of them are reborn among the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife.

original: de ji ltar tshul khrims kun tu spyad cing nye bar bsags par gyur pa'i rnam pa de lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ji ltar tshul khrims kun tu spyad cing nye bar bsags par gyur pa'i rnam pa de lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: They are reborn there in accordance with the way they have practiced and accumulated discipline.

original: de bzhin du lha rnams kyi ris gzhan du'ang tshul khrims dge bar gyur pa gang dag kho nas nye bar bskyod par gyur nas lha rnams bag med par spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du lha rnams kyi ris gzhan du'ang tshul khrims dge bar gyur pa gang dag kho nas nye bar bskyod par gyur nas lha rnams bag med par spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, they are also reborn in other god realms, in accordance with the virtuous discipline they have practiced.

original: ci srid tha mar 'phags pa'i phyag rgya thob par gyur pa de srid na phyir yang spyod pa ni /🔽ma yin no //
analyzed: ci srid tha mar 'phags pa'i phyag rgya thob par gyur pa de srid na phyir yang spyod pa ni / ma yin no //
translated: As long as they have not attained the ultimate seal of the noble ones, they will continue to engage in conduct.

original: de dag rnams bsod nams zad nas phyis yang dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams su skye'o //
analyzed: de dag rnams bsod nams zad nas phyis yang dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams su skye'o //
translated: When their merit is exhausted, they will be reborn in the realms of hell beings, starving spirits, and animals.

original: bsod nams zad par gyur pa yang yang bag med pa'i skyon gyis yin la /
analyzed: bsod nams zad par gyur pa yang yang bag med pa'i skyon gyis yin la /
translated: The exhaustion of their merit is due to the fault of carelessness.

original: gang yang bag med par spyod pa ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: gang yang bag med par spyod pa ma yin pa de ni /
translated: Those who do not engage in careless conduct

original: bde ba nas bde ba'i go 'phang du 'gro ste /
analyzed: bde ba nas bde ba'i go 'phang du 'gro ste /
translated: will progress from happiness to happiness.

original: de'i tshul khrims de legs par bsgoms pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag par gyur pa'i gzi brjid kyis yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshul khrims de legs par bsgoms pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag par gyur pa'i gzi brjid kyis yin no //
translated: Their discipline is well cultivated and its splendor is completely pure.

original: de'i phyir na bag med pas cung zad kyang ma gnas shig /🔽bag med pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir na bag med pas cung zad kyang ma gnas shig / bag med pa rnams ni /
translated: Therefore, do not remain careless even for a moment!

original: dug dang 'dra ba'o //🔽byis pa'i skye bo thams cad rab tu 'joms par byed pa /
analyzed: dug dang 'dra ba'o // byis pa'i skye bo thams cad rab tu 'joms par byed pa /
translated: Carelessness is like poison.🔽It destroys all childish beings.

original: don thams cad brlag par byed pa /
analyzed: don thams cad brlag par byed pa /
translated: It destroys all goals.

original: 'khor ba thams cad du 'ching bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba thams cad du 'ching bar byed pa yin no //
translated: It binds all beings in cyclic existence.

original: de lta bas na /🔽bag med pa rnams @186a *//
analyzed: de lta bas na / bag med pa rnams @186a *//
translated: Therefore,

original: ni; lha'am mi rnams kyis kyang mi bya'o //
analyzed: ni; lha'am mi rnams kyis kyang mi bya'o //
translated: the gods and humans should not be careless.

original: gang yang lha dang mi rnams kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gang yang lha dang mi rnams kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether gods or humans,

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i tshul khrims kyis mdzes par gyur nas skye bo rnams bag med pa'i skyon gyis 'da' bar byed pa de ni /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i tshul khrims kyis mdzes par gyur nas skye bo rnams bag med pa'i skyon gyis 'da' bar byed pa de ni /
translated: if they are beautiful due to such discipline, but then pass beyond it due to the fault of carelessness,

original: shin tu bslus pa'i rnyed pa can du gyur nas ngan 'gror gyur pa'i 'khor bar yang dus yun ring du yang 'khor bar yongs su 'khyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu bslus pa'i rnyed pa can du gyur nas ngan 'gror gyur pa'i 'khor bar yang dus yun ring du yang 'khor bar yongs su 'khyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will be greatly deceived and will wander for a long time in the miserable existences of cyclic existence.

original: de ltar mu su lundha 'dis lha de dag rnams la ston par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar mu su lundha 'dis lha de dag rnams la ston par byed do //
translated: In this way, Musulundha teaches the gods.

original: gang sems can rnams la thugs brtse ba po bcom ldan 'das des lha dang mi rnams la phan pa'i don du rdzu 'phrul mdzad nas sprul pa'i mchod rten ni /
analyzed: gang sems can rnams la thugs brtse ba po bcom ldan 'das des lha dang mi rnams la phan pa'i don du rdzu 'phrul mdzad nas sprul pa'i mchod rten ni /
translated: “The Blessed One, who has compassion for sentient beings, has performed a miracle for the benefit of gods and humans.

original: byang bu la bris pa de thos nas kyang lha rnams shin tu yid byung bar gyur pas kyang 'khor ba la skyo ba skye'o //
analyzed: byang bu la bris pa de thos nas kyang lha rnams shin tu yid byung bar gyur pas kyang 'khor ba la skyo ba skye'o //
translated: The gods, having heard what was written on the tablet, were very much distressed and became disgusted with cyclic existence.

original: bag med pa rnams kyang dug bzhin du spong ngo //🔽dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma'i rnam grang rnams ni /
analyzed: bag med pa rnams kyang dug bzhin du spong ngo // dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma'i rnam grang rnams ni /
translated: They abandoned heedlessness as if it were poison.🔽The various types of layperson have been explained.

original: bshad nas dge sbyong gi 'khor rnams ni /🔽gang dag yin /
analyzed: bshad nas dge sbyong gi 'khor rnams ni / gang dag yin /
translated: What are the various types of monastic?

original: rnam pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa ni /
translated: What are their characteristics?

original: du yod / yon tan ni /
analyzed: du yod / yon tan ni /
translated: What are their qualities?🔽What is their basis?

original: ci yin / cis gnas pa yin /
analyzed: ci yin / cis gnas pa yin /
translated: What is their vow?

original: sdom pa ji lta bu yin; dge sbyong rnams kyi sdom pa skye ba'i rnam pa rnams ni /🔽du zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: sdom pa ji lta bu yin; dge sbyong rnams kyi sdom pa skye ba'i rnam pa rnams ni /🔽du zhig yod ce na /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi dge sbyong ma dang / dge sbyong gang dag kyang mya ngan @186b las 'das pa'i don du spyod par byed pa nyin dang mtshan du bsam gtan byed pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pas bdud kyi 'khor rnams rnam par skrag par byed par gyur pa de dag rnams la dge sbyong ma rnam pa du yod na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi dge sbyong ma dang / dge sbyong gang dag kyang mya ngan @186b las 'das pa'i don du spyod par byed pa nyin dang mtshan du bsam gtan byed pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pas bdud kyi 'khor rnams rnam par skrag par byed par gyur pa de dag rnams la dge sbyong ma rnam pa du yod na /
translated: What are the female ascetics like?

original: mkhas pa / gsal ba /
analyzed: mkhas pa / gsal ba /
translated: They are wise, clear,

original: dul ba / 'jigs pa med pa /
analyzed: dul ba / 'jigs pa med pa /
translated: disciplined, fearless,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba po /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba po /
translated: and they go to the city of nirvāṇa.

analyzed: de kho na nyid la rjes su dpyod par gyur pa rnams kyis kyang tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur nas rjes su dpyod par gyur na ni /

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'jug par nus pa'ang ma yin no //

analyzed: 'di na bud med yon tan ji lta bu rnams dang ldan pa yin na /

analyzed: sbyor ba rnams thams cad nyid la mchog tu gyur pa thams cad du mun pa rnams so //

analyzed: de bzhin du gyur pa las dang po kho na thams cad nyid nas de kho na nyid la so sor rtog par byed de /

translated: When one sees men of equal age or older, one should cultivate the perception of them as one’s brother or father.

analyzed: de la de dag rnams ni /
translated: They are

analyzed: gnyid log pa dang sad pa rnams sam /

translated: For women who are dominated by attachment, the antidote is to contemplate the body as it is in reality, as being ugly.🔽The body is a mass of various kinds of filth, a receptacle for all kinds of diseases, and a mass of festering wounds.

original: lus kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la rab tu dpyod par byed de /
analyzed: lus kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la rab tu dpyod par byed de /
translated: One should examine the nature of the body, whether it is one’s own or someone else’s.

analyzed: lus 'di ci las byung bar 'gyur na /

translated: He sees that his body was generated from the impure mass of his parents’ semen and blood.

original: des kyang lus gzugs ngan pa dang mi gtsang ba ste /
analyzed: des kyang lus gzugs ngan pa dang mi gtsang ba ste /

analyzed: mi gtsang ba yin na gal te bdag cag gi lus de la gtsang @190a *//

analyzed: mar gyur pa cung zad tsam zhig yod dam bya bar ro // gzhan yang des de kho na nyid tshol zhing lta bar byed pa na lus 'di ni /

analyzed: rma dgu nas mi gtsang ba rnams yongs su 'dzag pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, when he searches for and observes reality, he sees that this body is a wound from which impure substances flow.

analyzed: bud med rnams dang skyes pa rnams la'ang dgu yin no //

analyzed: dgu po rnams kyang gang zhe na / nye bar 'byung ba lhag par gyur pa ni /

original: bud med rnams yin pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bud med rnams yin pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The excess of the arising of women is🔽that they have nine wounds.

original: nye bar gnas pa'i num gnyis po las so //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa'i num gnyis po las so //
translated: from the two openings of the anus.

original: bshang ba dang gci ba dang sna'i bu ga dag las sna bas yongs su 'bab bo //
analyzed: bshang ba dang gci ba dang sna'i bu ga dag las sna bas yongs su 'bab bo //
translated: From the two openings of the anus, the urethra and the mouth of the nose, the excrement flows out.

original: mig gnyis las ni /
analyzed: mig gnyis las ni /
translated: From the two eyes,🔽tears.

original: mchi ma'o // rna ba gnyis las ni /
analyzed: mchi ma'o // rna ba gnyis las ni /
translated: From the two ears,🔽wax.

original: dri ma'o // kha nas ni /
analyzed: dri ma'o // kha nas ni /
translated: From the mouth,

original: khrag dang rnag go /
analyzed: khrag dang rnag go /
translated: blood and pus.🔽From the body, there flows a hundred impure streams, such as wind, bile, phlegm, blood, excrement, and urine.

original: dri nga na pa dang ldan pa rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / khrag dang / bshang ba rnams dang / de lta bu la sogs pa mi gtsang ba gzhan yang brgya phrag lus las yongs su 'bab pa rnams de kho na nyid bsgoms pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ngo //🔽bdag cag gi lus la gtsang mar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: dri nga na pa dang ldan pa rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / khrag dang / bshang ba rnams dang / de lta bu la sogs pa mi gtsang ba gzhan yang brgya phrag lus las yongs su 'bab pa rnams de kho na nyid bsgoms pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ngo // bdag cag gi lus la gtsang mar gyur pa ni /
translated: In our bodies, there is not a drop of pure substance.

original: cung zad dam bag tsam yang mi 'bab na /
analyzed: cung zad dam bag tsam yang mi 'bab na /
translated: If there is not even a drop of pure substance in our bodies,

original: de la su zhig lus 'di legs par 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: de la su zhig lus 'di legs par 'dzin par byed /
translated: who would hold on to this body?

original: gang yang rten 'di dang phrad nas gtsang ma de dag rnams @190b kyang lus 'di mi gtsang ba'i dbang gis gzhan nyid kho nar 'gyur bar des yang dag par so sor rtog par byed pa na gang de dag rnams kho na lus 'di dang 'brel par gyur pa
analyzed: gang yang rten 'di dang phrad nas gtsang ma de dag rnams @190b kyang lus 'di mi gtsang ba'i dbang gis gzhan nyid kho nar 'gyur bar des yang dag par so sor rtog par byed pa na gang de dag rnams kho na lus 'di dang 'brel par gyur pa
translated: When he examines this body and these pure things, he sees that when they come into contact with this impure body, they become something else entirely.

original: gtsang ma rnams thams cad kyang de kho na bzhin du mi gtsang bar 'gyur bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: gtsang ma rnams thams cad kyang de kho na bzhin du mi gtsang bar 'gyur bar mthong ngo //
translated: He sees that all those pure things become impure just by being in contact with this body.

original: dper na / gal te 'dis zas dang skom bsod pa rnams thams cad med par gyur la /
analyzed: dper na / gal te 'dis zas dang skom bsod pa rnams thams cad med par gyur la /
translated: For example, if all the delicious food and drink were to disappear,

original: lus de dang 'grogs pas phyi sar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus de dang 'grogs pas phyi sar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the body would be left behind, and it would be excreted later on.🔽In the same way, what is eaten is all turned into something impure inside.

original: de bzhin du zos pa rnams kyang de ltar nang du thams cad du mi gtsang bar byed pa yin no; ;phyi rol du'ang lus 'di dang sprad pa las gtsang ba de rnams 'dis mi gtsang bar byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du zos pa rnams kyang de ltar nang du thams cad du mi gtsang bar byed pa yin no; ;phyi rol du'ang lus 'di dang sprad pa las gtsang ba de rnams 'dis mi gtsang bar byed de /
translated: And externally, those pure things become impure just by coming into contact with this body.

original: dper na / dris bsgo bar byed pa'i dri rnams thams cad kyang lus dang brten pa na rdul gyi skyon gyis dri mi zhim par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / dris bsgo bar byed pa'i dri rnams thams cad kyang lus dang brten pa na rdul gyi skyon gyis dri mi zhim par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example,🔽all the fragrant scents that are applied to the body become foul-smelling due to the fault of the body’s impurities.

original: de bzhin du dri zhim po'i me tog rnams thams cad kyang lus dang brten pas rnying pa dang dri mi zhim par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dri zhim po'i me tog rnams thams cad kyang lus dang brten pas rnying pa dang dri mi zhim par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, all fragrant flowers that are applied to the body become old and foul-smelling.

original: dge slong ma de de ltar gzhan yang de kho na ltar lus la so sor rtog par byed pa gang gis lus 'di nges par 'dzin pa ma'i tha snyad kyis kyang lus 'di gtsang ngam /
analyzed: dge slong ma de de ltar gzhan yang de kho na ltar lus la so sor rtog par byed pa gang gis lus 'di nges par 'dzin pa ma'i tha snyad kyis kyang lus 'di gtsang ngam /
translated: “The nun, examining the body in this way, thinks, ‘Is this body, which is definitely grasped by the convention of “mother,” clean?

original: ci ste mi gtsang ba zhig yin /🔽de nas dge slong ma so sor dpyad par gyur pa na rigs rgyud rnams kyi ma gang yin pa de'ang lus spyir mi gtsang @191a *//
analyzed: ci ste mi gtsang ba zhig yin / de nas dge slong ma so sor dpyad par gyur pa na rigs rgyud rnams kyi ma gang yin pa de'ang lus spyir mi gtsang @191a *//
translated: Or is it unclean?’

original: pa yin par mthong ngo //
analyzed: pa yin par mthong ngo //
translated: Then, as the nun examines it, she sees that the mother of the family lineage is generally unclean.

original: gzhan yang dge slong ma des gang la'ang lus 'di gnas pa'am 'dug pa'i sa phyogs rnams dang / yul phyogs dag cig gtsang bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong ma des gang la'ang lus 'di gnas pa'am 'dug pa'i sa phyogs rnams dang / yul phyogs dag cig gtsang bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Moreover, the nun will think, “Is there any place where this body could stay or sit that would be clean, or is there any country that would be clean?”

original: mi gtsang ba yin zhes lus de nyid la so sor rtog par byed do //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba yin zhes lus de nyid la so sor rtog par byed do //
translated: She will then examine the body itself.

original: des yang de ltar so sor brtags par gyur pa na mchog tu gtsang ba shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i yul phyogs gang dag la lus 'di shi ba'am /
analyzed: des yang de ltar so sor brtags par gyur pa na mchog tu gtsang ba shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i yul phyogs gang dag la lus 'di shi ba'am /
translated: When she examines it in this way, she will see that there is no place that is clean, pure, and special where this body could be placed, whether it is alive or dead.

original: gson pa'ang rung ste bzhag par gyur pa na srin bu dang / dri ma dang / skra dang / rus pa dang bcas pa yin pas yul phyogs thams cad kyang dri mi zhim par lus dang 'brel bas 'gyur bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong /
analyzed: gson pa'ang rung ste bzhag par gyur pa na srin bu dang / dri ma dang / skra dang / rus pa dang bcas pa yin pas yul phyogs thams cad kyang dri mi zhim par lus dang 'brel bas 'gyur bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong /
translated: She will see that all places become impure and smelly when they are connected with this body, which is full of worms, impurities, hair, and bones.

original: gzhan yang lus de nyid la dge slong ma des 'dod chags spang bar bya ba'i ched du so sor rtog par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang lus de nyid la dge slong ma des 'dod chags spang bar bya ba'i ched du so sor rtog par byed de /
translated: Moreover, in order to give up desire, the nun will examine the body.

original: lus 'di gang gis za bar byed; bya rnam pa de lta bu dag gis de so sor rtog par gyur pa las srin po dang sha za la sogs pa mi gtsang bar gyur pa rnams nyid las gzhan rnams gang zhig gis 'di za bar byed /

analyzed: rnam pa bzhi'o //

original: bzhi po gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi po gang zhe na /

analyzed: de ltar gcig pu rgyu bar byed pa'i rnam pa las dge slong dang gcig pu lam du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: In this way, a monk should not travel on the road alone, except in the form of a single person.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: dge slong gcig pu zhig ljongs rgyur 'gro ba na 'phya bar 'gyur ro //

original: rang dgar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang dgar yang 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rang dgar gyur pas kyang bslab pa'i gzhi rnams las 'da' bar byed do //

original: dge slong gzhan la 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan la 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: des yul ljongs kyi bud med dag mngon du mthong nas reg dogs kyi sems g-yo bar gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyis mig gtod par byed do //

analyzed: de la smad par gyur pa na kun tu zhe sdang ba skye'o //

original: 'di ni / rnam pa gcig yin no //

analyzed: 'di na dge slong lam du 'gro ba na lus su gtogs pa la 'gro ba'i dus su dran pa bskyed par bya ste /
